item.title: Resources
item.description: Resources During Prospective Student Days, we will use a few different platforms to facilitate your virtual visit: Kumospace Kumospace is an immersive video chat platform that allows people to mingle within a virtual event space. During Prospective Student Days, our social events will take place on Kumospace at this link. After logging in, you can move about the virtual room using your computerâ€™s arrow keys. You will be able to hear the people close to you in the virtual space, and as you move away from them, their audio will fade out.

item.title: Schedule
item.description: Schedule Wednesday, February 17th 6:00p onward Welcome Social (Prospective and Current Graduate Students) Kumospace Thursday, February 18th 10:00a - 10:30a Information Session Zoom 10:30a - 11:00a Break 11:00a - 11:40a Faculty Meeting 1 Zoom (see email) 11:45a - 12:25p Faculty Meeting 2 Zoom (see email) 12:30p - 1:10p Break (Lunch) 1:15p - 2:25p Faculty Meeting 3 Zoom (see email) 2:30p - 3:10p Faculty Meeting 4 Zoom (see email) Friday, February 19th 10:00a - 11:00a Lab Meetings

item.title: Virtual Tour
item.description: Virtual Tour Campus Although Columbia University was established in 1754, it moved throughout New York City several times before settling in its current location in 1897. Schermerhorn Hall, the location of the psychology department, is one of the original buildings in this current location. To learn more, check out the following virtual tour! Morningside Heights Columbia is located in the Morningside Heights, which is nestled between the Upper West Side and Harlem in the borough of Manhattan.
